title: Who are the most famous K-pop groups? - Quora

response.answer_text: To the surprise of nobody, BTS was the most buzzed about K-pop act on the site, and each of its seven members were the most talked about K-pop stars. Stray Kids, EXO, Monsta X, NCT 127, and their associated members were also among some of the most popular K-pop act on the site. BTS is the overall second-most interacted with entity on Tumblr in 2019, second only to Good Omens. The top K-pop star on Tumblr in 2019 was BTS' youngest member Jungkook, followed by Jimin, V, Suga, RM, Jin, and J-Hope, respectively. Stray Kids' Bang Chan, EXO's Baekhyun, and NCT 127's Jaehyun rounded out the top 10. Jennie of BLACKPINK, ranked at No. 27, is the most-talked about female K-pop star. BLACKPINK was the seventh most popular K-pop group on the site this year. “There are five women in the top 50, three members of BLACKPINK and three members of Red Velvet,” says Amanda Brennan, head of Content Insights & Social at Tumblr, who then referred to BLACKPINK’s performance at Coachella and tours from both acts as potential reasons behind the surge. “Even though the conversation can be dominated by boy groups, and boy groups tend to do more interviews in the U.S. than girl groups, I think girl groups are really having a moment and finding their fans when it may be a bit harder for them. We found 19 total women in the top 100, and I hope there are more next year.” Last year, only TWICE’s Momo appeared in Tumblr’s Top 100 ranking of individual K-pop stars. Stray Kids’ rise to the second biggest act on the site reflects a trend among Tumblr’s users that Brennan says reflects their love of rookie K-pop acts, pointing to how ATEEZ, which debuted this year, ranked at No. 9, and other newer teams like The Boyz, ITZY, SuperM, Tomorrow X Together, and others made it among the ranking. “When it comes to finding new groups, Tumblr’s ahead of the curve,” she says. “You find your group, and they become your babies. You love them and support them.” Though the data is gathered from Tumblr’s global audience, the fact that the site is an English-language site based in the U.S. reflects American trends particularly, and Brennan says that many of the groups gained traction when they toured or appeared in the U.S. Other factors, such as legal issues and departures from groups, also were reflected, as Tumblr does not take into account the way people engage with content on the site in its ranking. As such, someone like Seungri, who left BIGBANG after coming under investigation for a series of criminal allegations, appears on the list. BUT! KPOP GETS BIGGER AND BIGGER EVERY DAY AND EVERY SECOND  BTS  BLACKPINK  TXT (Tomorrow X Together)  Big Bang.  Stray Kids  EXO  ITZY  ATEEZ  SuperM  NCT  Red Velvet source: Tumblr and Google Stay safe Stay happy 😊 saranghae Signing off, Nicole 📝 💜💜💜💜💜💜

It really depends - do you mean the legendary groups or the currently popular/relevant groups? If you mean the legendary groups, there is Big Bang, SNSD, and 2NE1. There are also more groups like H.O.T., Super Junior, KARA, or Wonder Girls. Although these groups were extremely popular, they aren’t too relevant at the moment. 2NE1 disbanded and most of the members of Big Bang are serving time in the military. H.O.T. was more popular in the very first era of K-pop and isn’t talked about as much. Even if they aren’t currently relevant, everyone will know what you’re talking about if you mention them. Big Bang is a five-member boy group consisting of T.O.P, Seungri, G-Dragon, Daesung, and Taeyang. Some popular songs they have made are ‘Fantastic Baby’, ‘If You’, and ‘Bang Bang Bang’. They were formed by YG Entertainment. The majority of the members are currently serving time in the military as it is mandatory in South Korea.  2NE1 was a four-member girl group composed of Park Bom, CL, Dara, and Minzy. One popular song they made was ‘I Am the Best’, a truly iconic song. Later on, in their careers, Park Bom was involved in a drug scandal, leading to her being inactive for a long period of time. Her Instagram was found one or two years ago. CL focused on a music career in America, releasing ‘Hello Bitches’ and ‘Lifted’. Minzy was the first member to leave the group. After years of inactivity, it was officially stated that 2NE1 disbanded. Both 2NE1 and Big Bang were good friends - they were both formed by YG Entertainment and were both extremely successful at the time.  SNSD, otherwise known as Girls Generation, is a girl-group originally composed of nine members. Since then, four have left. Some popular songs they made are ‘Gee’, ‘Oh!’, ‘Run Devil Run’, and etc. They recently made a comeback called ‘Lil Touch’. Sooyoung, Tiffany, Seohyun, and Jessica have left the group. Jessica was actually voted to be kicked out of the group. People speculated that it was because she was focusing too much on her fashion line at the time, and didn’t pay enough attention to the group.  The currently relevant/popular groups are probably Blackpink, EXO (I don’t think they have released any new music recently, though), BTS (obviously), Red Velvet, TWICE, Stray Kids, and NCT. These groups are very popular when it comes to American fans, but I, unfortunately, do not know how popular some of these groups are in Korea as I haven’t been there in a long time. I believe Red Velvet really reached their peak with Bad Boy and Peek-A-Boo because of the dark, sexier, femme fatale concept. The members from left to right are Joy, Yeri, Irene, Seulgi, and Wendy. Their most recent comeback, Power Up, is a cuter concept with a heavy use of yellows and blues - the complete opposite of Bad Boy and Peek-A-Boo.  Blackpink has always been popular since they debuted. If I’m remembering correctly, they won an award for the most successful debut. Jennie, a main vocal and rapper in the group, is the Korean ambassador for Chanel. The members left to right are Rose, Jisoo, Jennie, and Lisa. All of the members except for Jisoo were born in foreign countries. Rose is a main vocal and has been featured in a few songs before her debut. Lisa is the main dancer and rapper. A dance cover she did for Cardi B’s ‘I Like It’ recently came out.  TWICE was created through a competition/reality TV show, Sixteen. All of the members of the group except for two won the competition and consequently became immediate members of TWICE. Tzuyu and Momo, although disqualified, were voted by fans and chosen by JYP to join the group. They have released a number of popular songs such as ‘What is Love’, ‘TT’, ‘Dance the Night Away’, and they have recently made a Japanese debut. Their next comeback, ‘Yes or Yes’ will come out soon. TWICE usually sticks to cute concepts which make fans worried - the overuse of one concept can devastatingly lead to the fall of the group. The members from left to right are Tzuyu, Jeongyeon, Sana, Jihyo, Nayeon, Chaeyeon, Dahyeon, Mina, and Momo.  BTS is possibly the most famous K-pop group out there. It’s a familiar name to people who don’t listen to K-pop as they are talked about all the time. BTS has attended multiple American music award programs and events, such as the AMAs. Some of their popular songs are ‘Fake Love’, ‘DNA’, and ‘Idol’. There are more, but those are just a few. The members from left to right are V (Taehyung), Suga, Jin, Jungkook, RM (stands for Rap Monster, real name is Namjoon), Jimin, and J-Hope.  I don’t know much about EXO as I don’t often listen to boy groups. I do know that many of the members are Chinese, forming a Korean-Chinese group. Originally, there were 12 members, but three have left since then. Tao, a former EXO member, was actually in the Chinese Produce 101 (competition based show similar to Sixteen), helping the female trainees train and debut. The picture below shows all 12 members. Tao, Lu Han, and Kris Wu have left.  Stray Kids is a nine-member rookie group, debuting last year. My knowledge is weak with this group.  NCT is a K-pop group with an unlimited amount of members, similar to Wonder Girls. It has multiple subgroups: NCT U, NCT 127, NCT Dream, and NCT 2018. Why there are so many groups is a question I cannot answer. I’ll leave a website link that has each member with their name if the picture is too difficult to read.
